title: Hebrews: Faith that Endures
objective: Be strengthened by examples of faith and practical exhortations for steadfast discipleship.

required_passages.text: Faith is the assurance of things hoped for... since we are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses... let us run with endurance... Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today and forever.

segments.audio_script: Hebrews closes by calling believers to run the race with eyes fixed on Jesus.

Listen to Hebrews 11-13. The writer recounts faithful saints who lived by promise, not sight. Believers are urged to run with endurance, accepting God's loving discipline, pursuing holiness and peace, and offering worship that honors God. Practical instructions cover love, hospitality, marriage faithfulness, contentment, and obedience to faithful leaders.
The community needed both theological confidence and practical stability under pressure.
Faith is persevering trust in God's promises fulfilled in Christ. Endurance is sustained by disciplined hope, shared community life, and unchanging confidence in Jesus.
Key themes include faith, endurance, discipline, holiness, community ethics, worship, and Christ's unchanging nature.
Reflect on this: What weight must you lay aside to run with endurance in your current season?
Fix your eyes on Jesus and run faithfully. Next we turn to James and living faith in daily trials.
